rComments: The passionate teaching style that fits those who likes to discuss in class. Got readings to do every week but overall easy and enjoyable class.

This course is very interesting given that the professor is very knowledgeable and honest. He provides opportunities for students to engage in class and will repeat things if necessary. His assessments are fair and is caring if you show your efforts to him (i.e. visit office hours).
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Really interesting class and a knowledgable professor. I did find his insertion of political ideology as facts a little disturbing so be aware of that going in. Showing up to class and tutorial is a must and keep up with the reading. Other than that I would classify it as a bird course

Professor Hunter is a great professor. He cares about his students and will ensure that you receive a fair mark. I was stuck with a group who really brought down my mark and he was willing to make a compromise to make sure that the grade I received is reflective of the effort that I put in.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Assignment instructions are pretty good. He's also pretty engaging and will address your concerns
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Professor Hunter is amazing! His classes are engaging and informative. If you pay attention in class and read readings, its an amazing course!! Youll do great
Would also want to tag: inspirational; accessible outside class; get ready to read (but he downloads all readings--no text $$ to spend!); skip class you won't pass; clear grading criteria; caring.

Mark Hunter has to be one of the best professors at Uoft Scarborough. He's always there to provide feedback/ assistance. His assignments are different; from group projects, blog posts, autobiography, etc. Overall Geographies of Education is one of the best classes I have taken at Uoft.
His passion for research is clearly evident but his teaching style is mediocre. Assignment instructions could be clearer.
Tends to avoid addressing students' concerns about their grades. Assignment instructions are minimal.
Not very clear on what he wants on the assignments.
Loved him! hes only easy because he is that good of a teacher. Hes very clear. He tells you exaclty what he wants.

AMAZING PROFESSOR! Super engaging, knows what he's talking about, and his British accent just makes it all the more interesting! If you take amazing notes in lecture and perhaps tutorial, you're almost guaranteed an 80+ mark!
